text: Really nice, bottle from Bob. A bit of dark fruit along with the usual stout profile roasty, chocolate, not super sweet though thankfully. Well balanced. Delicious.
Pours a very dark brown with a short reddish-tan head. Coffee, dark chocolate, and charred wood nose. Thick mouthfeel. Quite a bit of honeydew melon in the flavor. Chocolate and smoky wood.

Bottle. Very dark, luscious black. Opaque. Think appearance. Tan head. Chocolatey aroma, dark malt, slight sweet notes, roast. Delectable aroma. Flavor is low chocolate, high roast, dark malt, bakers cocoa. Light vanilla notes. Very nice.
Bottle - pours black tan head - nose/taste of wood, cocoa, chocolate cake and milk sugar - medium body

330 ml bottle. Black body with a big, dense beige head. Strong and pleasant aroma of roasted dark malt, coffee and chocolate. Flavor is sweet dark malt, chocolate, dry fruit, hint of wood and balanced bitterness. Fine balanced body and good, long lasting aftertaste. Very nice, very tasty, very smooth.

Bottled (backlog). Deep brown colour with a mediumsized brown head. Aroma is roasted, some chocolate, mild roasted notes as well as some lactic and mild creamy notes. Flavour is roasted malts, some chocolate, mild wooden and lactic notes as well as some sweetish mildly buttery notes. Big in the palate.
On tap at Ratebeer Best. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, smoke, wood. Medium body, rich malt, roast, dark chocolate, wood, ash, dry finish, very good.

31-01-17 // bottle at home. Pours a deep dark black beer with a lovely solid beige foamy head. Nose is chocolate sweet. Taste is tropical, chocolate, cocoa, light fruit touches, orange, lactose. Very well balanced, not to sweet. Full bodied. Love it.

Appearance: Black as the deepest dungeon. A nice big beige head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Nice intensity.Palate: Medium to full body. Tad sweet with an ok bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Rum, fruity, dark malt, coffee and chocolate.Overall impression: Solid stuff. Very pleasant and balanced.Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden
Bottle from Bestway Greensboro- Very chocolate, sweet, not sure what the cypress is adding, but I like it.

Cask Half Pint at White Horse Old Ale Festival 2012, Parsons Green, London in Nov 2015 - Opaque Black in colour. Average foamy beige brown head. Slight lacing. Very Malty; intense, dark chocolate, coffee, roasty (slightly burnt) malts, caramel, wood, vanilla and lactose. Fruity; orange, chocolate orange, some dark fruits. Bit Spicy. Hoppy; some balancing citrusy hop bitterness. Rich, smooth. Initially sweet chocolatey roast malty and fruity but increasingly bitter (and a little salty) into the finish. Good stuff. Very enjoyable. Lovely Foreign Stout! (2015-11-19)

(Bottle) Black colour with dense, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of chocolate, cacao, vanilla, milky coffee, hints of tropical fruit and some wood. Malty, roasted taste with dark chocolate, cacao, vanilla, black coffee, liquorice, hints of cedar wood, and a balanced roasty bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Very well balanced with a generous chocolate character. Excellent!
W aromacie dużo kakao, kokosa, czekolady. Smak lekko słodki, czekoladowo kokosowy, bardzo dobre.
Mocno przypomina ciasta w stylu jakiegoś murzynka. Kakao, cynamon, sporo paloności, dość wytrawny finisz. Świetne.
Shared 33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roast and cocoa. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, lactose, molasses notes, and wood. Good.
Pretty good beer. It does indeed smell and taste like chocolate cake. I dont know where the Caribbean part comes from but its good stuff.
Bottle - a deep brown black colour with a tan head. Roasted malt and rich dark chocolate aroma. The taste is sweet a dark chocolate bitterness with light roasted malt and whiskey flavours.
Black with a tan head. Aroma is bitter chocolate, coffee, and slight vanilla. Taste is bitter chocolate and sweet spices.
Aroma: tons of chocolate; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that lingers; Taste: nicely complex stout; sweet; smooth; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: Nice. Would get again.
Bottle at home listening to records. Strong whiskey overtones but smooth sipping all the same. A real winner

Dark brown with little light brown head. Aroma is lots of nuts, some pepper, dark chcoclate, cocoa. Taste is very sweet, some dark chocolate bitterness, smooth and good. Coffee in the finish. This one did it right.

(bottle) murky black/brown colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of toasted malts, nougat and cherry schnaps, with some notes of brown sugar, treacle, vanilla icing and dark chocolate. flavour is mostly roasted malts, some ash and yeast, slightly sweet, with lots of brown sugar, a hint of earth, more nougat and a light roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.
From a bottle. Deep black with small brown head. Dark chocolate, roasted malts and liquorice in the aroma. Sweet taste with dark chocolate and coffee notes to balance. Overall, a delicious brew.

11.2 oz. bottle from Louisville Beer Store; shared with Boo. Aroma: Big, rich cocoa notes with a not negligible amount of soy sauce, lighter woody hints around the periphery; missing some of the fruitier aspects I enjoy in other foreign stouts. Appearance: Inky black pour with a bubbly, dark mocha head that settles into a thin ring. Flavor: Dark chocolate- and somewhat lesser soy sauce- rule, but are met at the start by lactose; woody notes linger on at the finish, which is about as dry as youd expect a sweeter stout to get. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: Definitely one that gave me reservations at the start, but this worked out well in the end. If you like the occasional sweeter stout, but with some interesting character, this fits the bill.
On tap. Almost black, tan foam. Aroma: coffee, chocolate, cake, a little brandy. Taste: coffee, cake with chocolate, some brandy, espresso. Very good.
Vollmundig malziger Antrunk. Steigend schokoladig, damit einhergehend süßer. Wenig herb, vollmundig, im Nachhall schwerer, als es zuvor scheint. Langer Nachhall. 11/12/12/12//12

330 ml. bb 04 04 2017. Pours inky black with a thin smattering of brown bubbles. Aroma is rich chocolate torte with vanilla glaze and espresso with cream. Tastes of the same on the front, with a slow turn to toasted nut and wood. Long finish shows hints of soy and char. Medium-heavy with a smooth low-medium carbonation. As the name would indicate it is biased to the dessert beer side, but has a pretty drinkable balance all the same.

330ml bottle, bb 07.11.16. Dark brown pour, looks in the glass like molten chocolate. Intense aroma of dark chocolate, toasted malts with hints of liquorice. Tastes like dark chocolate, coffee, milky cream with a lot of dark chocolaty bitterness and smooth carbonation. Just like eating dark chocolate (with just a little bit too much lactose), nice desert to end the evening.

(Siren Cigar City Caribbean Chocolate Cake) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 7.4%
Black coloured body with a small dark brown head sitting on top, good density and average retention.
Aroma of roasted malts, milky chocolate, cocoa, light coffee, something spicy. 
Taste of milky chocolate, dark chocolate, sweet all in all, cocoa, light coffee, light liquorice. 
Medium body, soft carbonation, sticky palate. 
Nice.
Bottle. Pitch black, beige head. Lots of rum, dried fruits coffee and chocolate. The beer is sweet, quite roasty with bitter finish. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Great beer.
Bottle. The look is dark, thin latte head, and coffee colored. The smell is black rum cake, roast, coffee, dark chocolate, raisan, dessert. The taste is similar, cake chocolate sweetness, good.

Heavy black pour wth a thin dark tan head, but it quickly recedes and doesnt hold long. The nose is a bit weird, cedar-woody and full of quasi fruity chocolate tones. Rich earthy woody flavor thats full of roasted black malts, earthy bitter cocoa, and only a faint touch of chocolate sweetness. Not as cake-like as I had hoped, but there is just a little chocolaty sweetness toward the finish, with a lot of creamy lactose on the finish as well. Lots of wood in there.

Non Beer Trip Beer Trip Beer #30. Bottle shared by TMoney99 at a tasting, 3/9/16. Dark brown, thin fizzy tan head, good retention. Aroma of strong roasted malts, chocolate, coconut. The taste is nuts, coconut, vanilla, chocolate. Medium bodied, low carbonation.
12 ounce bottle at The Beer Trappe. Deep chocolate notes. Medium body. Fairly rich overall.

Sticky slick glossy black mass with some light acidity developing into a good black cakey sap.Dense cake, spice,cassis demerara sugar.
Very good.

Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is Sweet and Chocolate and i get cake out of it as well. Taste is sweet chocolate with smoky hints. Vanilla chocolate finish. Its pretty good but didnt blow me a way. Would love to try one of these with some coconut added.
12oz bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Nice chocolate flavor, not too sweet.

Bottle. Roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate, a bit of coffee, coconut and a bit of wood note as well. Pours very dark brown with a thin but retentive mocha brown head that also has good lacing. Starts with very sweet chocolate flavors as well as a bit of coconut. Finishes very smooth with roasted malt, slight coffee and a tiny bit of wood. Tastes like a chocolate cake for sure. Delicious.
Black body, brown head. Chocolate, mocca, dark fruits and tobacco in flavour. Sugary rum barrel sense. Flavour has sugars, ash, toasted vainilla, chocolate. Some Woody leather. Complex and great.

Draft at Mr Dunderbaks in Tampa during Hunahpu 16 weekend: black pour with big tan head. aroma of cocoa, caramel, toasty. tastes are dark chocolate, ashy, little woody, coffee. nice mix of sweet and bitter. oily palate.
UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Wow, this is smooth, moderate sweetness, lovely mild cocoa and chocolate with hint of spice, everything melds together so well.

An Italian nose? Subtle dark cherry vibes (like a Brunello di Montalcino wine) and a whiff of espresso. Full, roasty mouth  like the best bits of draught Guinness amplified yet balance. Very smooth, very velvety.

Black color with mocha head. Aroma is really chocolaty, fudgy and sweet with some fruit notes. Taste starts sweet as well but not overly, just enough to make the chocolate and fruit notes shine more. Finish is more balanced by some dark chocolate and cacao flavors. Full bodied with smooth carbonation. A really tasty stout and I also like that it doesnt have a huge ABV.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are largely dark bitter chocolate with roasted malts.
Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is burnt pineapple, dark chocolate. Taste is sweet caramelized pineapple with loads of tart dark chocolate. Delicious and interesting.
Very nice. Smokey and so forth. Sweet. Some other words to pad out to 80 chars.
Pours pitch black. Aroma is tons of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and a touch of lactose. Taste: thick liquid cocoa followed by coffee and a touch of spice (cypress wood?).

330 ml bottle. From England. HHOK19. Thanks to Jukka for this treat!
Black color with a tin bubbly tan head. 
Roasted malt, ashy dryness, plum and chocolate in the aroma. 
The flavor is roasted malt, dark fruits, mild berries and tobacco. 
Very tasty.

Aroma has a thick sweetness and berry scent, and the sugar is tasted upfront. Nice balance in that the body is thin initially with the full thickness of the chocolate hitting you in the aftertaste. A bit boozy with bitter dark fruit also. Very delicious beer. Bottle.

Draft at Craft Beer Co, Covent Gardens. Dark brown color without much head or lace. Just a ring of brown. Dark chocolate and roast. Spice, earth, and wood. Sweetness, spice, and bitterness all present. Nicely made, well balanced, and full of flavor. Good beer.

Tap takeover @Royal Navy Volunteer on 27/5/2016, Bristol, cask version. Dark brown in colour, with a moderately sized, tan, head. Plain chocolate, roasted malts, a hint of orange and vanilla before a dryish finish. Very good.

Tap takeover @Royal Navy Volunteer, Bristol.
Appearance: Very dark brown colour, tiny head, hazy. Aroma: dark chocolate, coffee, plum, oak. Taste: lightly bitter. Palate: full body, oliy, long finish. Excellent beer, very well balanced, very drinkable.
Bottle. Black and quite creamy. Medium body that is quite powerful without being threatening.A delightful stout.

On tap at CBC 2016. Pours black with short tan head.
Aromas of dry chocolate cake.
What a surprise flavors of same with rich syrupy chocolate icing
Dry almost flat

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black with a chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, cream. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, lightly sweet on the palate with slightly powdery finish. Taste is chocolate cake batter, vanilla, bourbon.

11.2 ounce bottle, best before 240916. Served in a Great Lakes snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. The brew smells like chocolate, cream, vanilla, and coffee. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also the addition of some nuts and dried/candied fruit. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its creamy and a bit coating with a moderate amount of carbonation. I think its a good stout, Id like to try this one again in the future. Recommended to anyone whos a fan of sweeter tasting stouts. $7.25 a bottle.
Sample at cbc. Pours black, no head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate. Taste is sweet, chocolate, nice balance.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is dark brown with small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Dark chocolate, chocolate, some vanilla and roasted malts.

Tap at CBC. Pours black with tan lace. Roma: fruity, roasted notes, coffee, chocokate. Very smooth and balanced. Medium bodied. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap@ CBC 2016. Black colored beer with a thin brown head. Rhum,  wood,  caramel,  chocolate in aroma. Quite cakey ,  sweet fruity,   rhummy notes. Roasted malty,  dark chocolate.  
Smooth.

Bottle. Black color with beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, cigar tobacco, coffee, nutty, vanilla. Taste is coffee, milk chocolate, lacto (very present here, not so much in the aroma). Rich enough for this ABV. Silky mouthfeel. Good one!
@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, YELLOWblack. Roasty malty thick aroma. Sweet barrelly. Full bodied, quite well balanced. Rich malty, nice.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Tap at cbc, copenhagen. Black color, brown head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee, vanilla and some creamy notes. Nice balanced body, roasted malts, vanilla and chocolate.
Schwarzes bier brauner schaum, Geruch holzig kalter rauch Asche, Geschmack kalter rauch malzig süß Kaffee, recht heftig
330ml Flasche. Schwarzes Bier mit cremigem rötlich-beigem Schaum. Kaffee und Rauch Aromen. Cognac Antrunk. Schokolade und Kaffee. Im Abgang Asche und Rauch. Sperriges Bier.

Kolor: piwo jest poprostu nieprzejrzy?cie czarne. Od góry zamyka je br?zowa piana, obfita, z drobnymi p?cherzykami, niezbyt trwa?a, pozostawia tylko nieznaczny ?lad na ?ciankach szklanki.
Aromat: palono??, gorzka kawa, zaraz potem s?odka, mleczna czekolada i ciastka.
Smak: ciastka, lekko s?one z mas? z kakao. Do tego oczywi?cie kawa i czekolada. Piwo jest bardzo g?ste, tre?ciwe i oleiste.
Goryczka w tym piwie jest szlachetna likierowa, w smaku ??czy si? i przeplata z mleczn? czekolad?. Wysycenie niskie.
Bottle, Oddbins West Hampstead. Deep black colour. Nice rich flavour, bitter roasted flavours with a nice richness from the lactose without any cloying notes. Nice and tasty.

01.05.2016 - 7,5cl proefglaasje (tap) op het Tilquin English Beer Festival

U: Zwart bier met mooie blijvende bruine schuimkraag
G: Cacao, met een vleugje rood fruit
S: Koffie en chocolade. Ook subtiele toetsen van vanille. Zoet bier met een mooie (licht)bittere afdronk. Zeer complex en zeer volmondig. Kan moeiteloos naast gelijkaardige bieren met veel hogere ABV staan. TOPBIER!

On tap at The Cock Tavern, London. Pours black with small light brownish head. Roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, sugar. Full bodied. Oily texture, low carbonation. Too sweet for me, but other than that its a nice brew.
Bottle at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is black with a dark tan head. Flavor and aroma of tropical fruit, cherries, oak, light chocolate, and dairy creamer. Finish has a bit more chocolate.

Sampled from a bottle. Black colour with a light brown head.Rich aromas of chocolate and freshly-baked bread. The taste is complex with milky coffee, chocolate, cigar ash and vine fruit all in the flavour. Very sweet, but balanced by a good bitterness. Very pleasant to drink. A memorably good beer.
Piwo niemal czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana trwała, drobnopęcherzykowa. W aromacie czekolada, kakao. W smaku podobnie, z goryczkowym finiszem. Pełnia wysoka. Wysycenie średnie. Świetne.

Drinked from bottle, bought in Bottle Apostle, Crouch End. Almost black with brown reflects. Very nice brown head. Pretty rich, but ir doesnt last too long. Roasted coffee and cocoa aromas are the base ones. But you can also feel yeast and bread. First sip is strange, but next ones are opening nice taste of that stout. Pretty sweet taste, with a bitterness at the end. Long and nice finish. Average carbonation, medium to full body, nice oily texture. Really good beer.

On tap at CBC Brixton a while ago. Jet black pour with creamy textured dark brown head. Aroma is chocolate, licorice, mild spices and a little cherry. Velvety smooth taste. Chewy. Cocoa, dark chocolate, thick milk stout texture, delicate spices and a slightly bitter finish. Good noms.

Draft. Medium brown head atop black-brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, wood/alcohol, light chocolate. Taste is moderately sweet, chocolate, light pepper, wood, alcohol. Creamy medium-full body, some stickiness.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 Bottle. Black, dark brown head. Dark chocolate, cherry, tropical, fruit notes. Mellow creamy moum Medium body. Sweet chocolate finish. Yummy
Bottle from Corti Brothers. Pours near black with an attractive tan head and a chocolate aroma. There is a milky chocolate flavor with a dry bitter finish. Lots of flavor.

Siren Chocolate Carribean Stout shared by Mick.

Inky black with a ruddy tan head. The aroma is rich savoury cacao nibs ands spices. The taste is dark chocolate paste , spices and deliciousness. Very soft easy drinking stuff, Siren never disappoints.

Bottle. Nose is rich coco, vanilla, faint hint of smoke, cream. Taste is gently smokey, lots of cream, very soft coco, vanilla, and a smokey faintly herbal, licorice, light hop and smoke finish. Further sips give a boiled lemon sweet effect, in the mid palate, perhaps lemon grass tea, which I guess is the wood?

Rich and delicious and beautifully balanced.

Dark brown/black color; Medium to heavy creamy body; Aroma of toasted  malt, cocoa/chocolate, some caramel, & coffee; Flavor of roasted/woody sweet malt, caramel, cocoa, coffee, dark chocolate, lactose, and some anise/licorice; Nicely balanced; Pretty decent.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a small brown head. good lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and wood. Flavor was sweet and silky smooth with dark chocolate, wood, roasted malts, vanilla, coffee, and had a bit of caramel. Oily texture, full body, soft carbonation.

pours black with tan head. A good aroma of chocolate and coffee with roasted malt and a little smokiness. Sweet chocolate flavour and more coffee and a little liquorice and spice. Smooth, silky oily mouthfeel with a little background fizz, slightly dry finish. A very flavoursome and excellent stout.

Pours dark chocolate brown with a thin tan head. Aroma delivers sweet chocolate, roast malt and licorice tones. Flavor features chocolate, roast malt and toffee tones. Mouthfeel presents typical body and fizz. Get caked!

Bottle. Pours jet black with thin brown head and medium carbonation. Full aroma of wood smoke, lemon, chocolate. Massive flavours of smoke, sweet chocolate, lemon, coffee, fizzy sherbet, earth and a gentle bitter finish. Sublimely smooth palate. Taste is maybe a bit too full on, one is enough. But an outstanding stout all the same.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Black beer with a hint of brown at the edges. Fairly dark head. Aroma is big on chocolate with medium lactose. Nice milk chocolate character to the beer. Solid hit of roast. The taste is fairly sweet. Even more roast than in the aroma. Nice milk chocolate flavor that goes well with that silky lactose feel. Some bitterness in the finish. I dont really know what the cypress is supposed to taste like, but it seems subtle. Very smooth feel, a touch of oil. Dries out some in the finish. Lots of flavor. Solid stout.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted chocolate, wood and fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout brew.

Got that tick at Tap House Munich. I saw they also have a Jerk Edition, but Im a nice guy so I got the regular one. Roasty AF aroma yet floral, woody, chocolatey. The flavor kills it. Dry, ashy charcoal roast, bitter chocolate, even a touch of milky sweetness. The sweet/bitter balance is spot on. Amazeballz feel. Slick, smooth, yet dry as you old wrinkly mother and not too thick (or as Germans would say, "dick"). Other stouts should emulate this feel. I liked this a lot.

11.2oz bottle, thanks to alexsdad06 for sharing. Very dark brown color. Ring of brown head, decent bits of lace, a film on the glass. I get some raspberry from this, interestingly. Dark chocolate. Bit of creme. Medium to bigger body. Kind of chewy, lighter carbonation. Mild slick texture. Good creamy feel. Moderate bitter, moderate to bigger sweet. Kind of fruity, but tasty stuff. Interesting.

Bottle from Bine & Vine. Pours dark brn/blk with a slight tan smear. Aroma is chocolate milk stout. Med + body. Flavor is chocolate, lactose, and maybe some wood. Very milk stout. Nice, but not super exciting.

33cl bottle at home from de Bierbrigadier, Eindhoven. Nose is roasty, light smoky. Body is pitch black, head is big, brown, creamy, average lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is old wood, carton, smoke, chimney pipe, light hot spicy, mild coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, dates, lemon grass. Medium sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium to heavy bitter, light alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, nearly flat carbonation. Excellent dessert beer, chocolate is not as dominant as I expected, very unique, great one.
Great stout, lots of flavours, chocolate, roasty aroma, thick head, malty malty beast. Delicious.

Robe brune presque noire, mousse crémeuse brune. Nez assez discret sur des notes de café au lait, de caramel, le chocolat et le cacao apparaissent à laération, légère noté épicée et boisée. Une bouche superbe avec une attaque sur le café au lait, une bulle crémeuse, de la tension, de léquilibre et une longueur impressionnante, finale dune grande élégance sur une note de café légèrement torréfié.

330 ml bottle at home thanks to Douberd! Pitch black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, lots of coffee in the beginning, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, dark fruits, dried fruits, wood. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma, chocolate, coffee, cocoa, light caramel and fruits. Full silky oily to creamy body with soft carbonation.

Pours pitch black with decent tan head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate and a hint of malt loaf, very slight metallic note coming through at the very end which I think is the wood. Body is amazingly smooth and rich. Soft bubbles but good carbonation for the style. Taste is heavily chocolate but not bitter chocolate, a good quality rich milk chocolate but not overly sweet. Finish develops into coffee and malt biscuits.

Bottle; pours black with a thin tan head; aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, with hints of wood and smoke; taste is chocolate, roasted malt, with some vanilla and wood hints; finish is slightly bitter and dry with some roasted notes; very nice

12 oz bottle enjoyed with ebone1988 and his bottle. The pour is a lighter black with a thin bubbly collar of dark khaki colored head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is initially a lot of chocolate. There is a bit of bready cake going on as well as a ton of roast. There is a little woodiness happening as well which is nice. It's not overly complex, and there is a little metallic on the finish, but it's not terrible. The flavor is pretty much all roast. There is a light creaminess and a hint of smoke that pokes through. No cocoa, and there's a light lactose happening on the back end. The mouth feel is pretty damn good. It's thick and viscous with an awesome creamy soft carbonation. There is a lingeringly roasty aftertaste with just a hint of chocolate milk. Not too bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle enjoyed with koleminer20, who had his own. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, some wood, slight booze, real nice. Appearance is black, lightbrown head, poured thin. Taste is lots of roasted malt, smoke, wood, chocolate, lactose, but not much else. Mouthfeel is like drinking whipping cream, super light carbonation, but very heavy body with a light chocolate heavy roast aftertaste. Overall, this is slightly disappointing, but still quite good.

Bottle pour opaque black with thin tan head. Nose chocolate covered orange, sweet malt, tobacco, carrot cake, light wood. Taste roasted malt up front, dark chocolate, sweet orange roast balanced by sweet malt. Roasted finish with hint of wood. Thick mouth feel.

Draft at BeerTemple. Cobweb-lacing, light beige, creamy head over a black beer with burgundy edges. Aroma of bitter chocolate, coffee grounds, warm cake, candied fig, blackberry, sweet madera. Sourish fruity onset (blackberries) with a dash of green olive umami and candied fig sweetness, soft to medium carbo, light metallic feel but not disturbing, smooth and full chocolatey and caramelly malt backbone with nutty and toasted edges, coffee and vanilla accents in the finish, creamy, with some peppery hops and a hint of warming, bourbon-like alcohol. Absolutely lovely, but I did not expect anything less from a collab of Cigar City and Siren.
Draft at Churchkey. Poured a very dark brown color, almost pitch black. Aroma was light rum notes, lots of roasted malts, tons of chocolate notes. Flavor was a lot like a rum chocolate cake.

Bottle. The pour is black. The aroma is chocolate, and some dark fruits. The taste is is like a fruity chocolate cake. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle. Chocolate and sweetness. It tastes just like a Jello pudding pop. Creamy body thats getting close to imperial stout territory.

(Bottle) Very small dark tan head. Black body Strong aroma of dark bittersweet cocoa. Flavor is simply amazing! Lots of cocoa again. But, this time with a nice sweetness to it, no doubt from the lactose. Finishes off with a woodiness on the palate and aftertaste like Im sucking on a dry tree branch. Could seriously sip this one all day long!

Pour is a thick black with a small tan head. Aroma is a nice bitter bakers chcocolate with some German chocolate cake. Flavor is a chocolate rum cake with a big chocolate bitterness. Big chocolate and a healthy dose of alcohol. Pretty flavorful beer. Like having a rich chocolate cake with a shot of dark rum.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black with a tan head. Roast, coffee, cocoa, bittersweet, chocolate. Medium to full-bodied.

33cl bottle direct from the brewery. A glossy black pour with a fast fading chocolate coloured head; lactic aroma; smooth with a chocolate fudge cake taste; and rich dry chocolate finish with some warmth. A peasant slow-sipping stout.
Draft. Pretty close to black color, brown head with good retention and lacing. Aroma has chocolate, vanilla, tannins. Taste is roasty vanilla, cocoa, more tannins, plums. Very tasty.

Tap at the Draft House Hammersmith, black with a thin crema, aromas of chocolate and wooden barrels, rich and winey at first, then turning into alcoholic chocolate gateau. Sweet and cloying yet also dry-bitter and woody.

pours black with a thin brown head. Very light spotty lacing. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, light smoke and light wood. Flavor:Semi-sweet chocolate, wood, coffee and vanilla. Medium bodied. OIly texture.Light bitter finish. Pricey but good.
12oz bottle. Black pour with a tan head. Chocolate, vanilla, roast, woodiness, lactose, and fruity.

Bottle. Pours black with a small, quickly dissipating, mocha head. Quite quickly, there is only a small ring of head around the glass. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, lactose. Not as sweet a taste as I would have expected; light to moderately bitter, actually, with a light sweetness underneath. Taste has lots of cocoa, chocolate, roasted malts, lactose. Medium+ bodied; smooth and oily; significantly below average carbonation. Finishes dry with roasted malts and cocoa lingering.

Das vielleicht beste Bier der Welt???? Keine Ahnung, aber auf jeden Fall sehr nah an der Perfektionsgrenze, wenn man denn auf abgefahrene und komplexe Extrembiere steht.UNFASSBAR LECKER....und sehr exotisch. Die Monterey Bar hats für mich gehabt. Vom Hahn und für 6,50 Euro die 0,3 Liter Tulpe. DANKE!!!!!!!
Estupenda Stout con intensas notas de café y chocolate tanto en aroma como en boca. Cremosa y muy fácil de beber. Era difícil que estas dos micro no se marcasen un cervezón.
Thick and oily. Light brown head that doesn't stick around. Lots of lactose and choco aromas. German choco came flavors with a long finish. The woodiness is very light, and fantastic.
Bought in bottle from Maison du Biere. Chocolate and coconut aroma. Rich taste. Delicious.

draft at RBWG 2016. An absolute amazing deep cocoa powder nose. Just like huffing Hershey powder. Like flourless cake. Pitch black with minimal head. Taste follows with a drying cocoa powder finish. Spot on

11.2 oz bottle from Party Source. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have dark chocolate, roasted malt, bigger wood character, sweet lactose, this has a very slick texture, and mild to moderate bitterness to the finish, the wood is fairly strong with this one, interesting beer.

Aroma - chocolate cherry cordial like aroma and some caramelized sugar.
Appearance - body is black. The head is about 1/2 and fallow in color. Settles slowly.
Taste - rich taste. Full roast, some cherry, dark chocolate, and fine quality sugar cane.
Palate - full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, long rich candied finish.

Bottle. Black pour with large brown foamy head that slowly fade and decent lace. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and wet leather. Soft and gentle mouth feel with flavors of dark chocolate, vanilla and coffee beans. Thick creamy palate.

Selymes állagú, sűrű, fekete színű, folyékony desszert, melyet már az illata is előjelez, porcukros kávés, tejszínes, kakaós aromái vannak. Ízében beköszön egy vékony mentás hálóval bevont, tamarindos, vaníliás, kókuszos egyveleg, faháncsos és étcsokoládés jegyek gondoskodnak a komplexitásról. Nem az a kiugró alkoholfok jellemzi, mégis testes és intenzív, mintha csak egy imperial verziót kortyolgatnánk, melyhez a visszafogott szénsavasság ugyancsak hathatós segítséget nyújt. Jól megbolondított stoutot hoztak össze a készítők.
Bottle. Mocha head, mahogany body. Oak, cocoa, chocolate, Marmite, blackcurrant, smoke. Bittersweet and savoury, some MSG. Dry finish. Warming.
Fast schwarze Farbe, mittelgroße bräunliche schaumkrone. Geruch süß röstmalzig, schokoladig, Vanille. Geschmack sehr süß, röstmalzig, schokoladig, mastig, okay.

From a 12 oz. bottle into a plastic cup in a Destin hotel room. Pours a thick, creamy, deep drown. Absolutely no head. Carbonation overall is very light. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, sugar, slightly woody. Taste is bitter chocolate with light hints of espresso. Bitter and sweet lactose. Smooth, dark roasted coffee. A little bit of wood on the finish. Very easy drinking. Lightly warming.

When on family holiday in Florida I went on a big hunt across Tampa to find a particular Cigar City beer. So, nice to find one, albeit a collaboration with the excellent Siren, in Beer Gonzo which is less then half a mile from my house. Almost black, and unlike its stronger cousins it keeps some of its lovely brown head and there is plenty of lacing. Body is thick and creamy. Nose is mostly milk chocolate, but there is also plummy fruit and something a bit tangy. Really good taste - coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, and there is a bit of bite akin to chili. Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Appearance: Black with a nice big creamy brown head.
Aroma: Roasted malts, smoke, chocolate,Wood, red apples.
Taste: Dark chocolate bitterness, a hint of Cofee, roasted malts, some tamarind, and wood Aftertaste is a true chocolate bitterness.
Creamy, soapy mouthfeel, Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Very well executed stout which rich taste can rival with its booy big imperial brothers.

Not really sure about the cypress wood, but as a nice solid quality stout this is pretty amazing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from the Cheese & Wine shop, Darlington. Black-brown colour, brown foam head leaving lacing and aroma of smokey roast malt, dark chocolate, coffee, lactose. Taste is smoke, roast malt, woody earthy, sweet, molasses, milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla and some light grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roast bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a darkest brown color with a bit of ruby highlighting, a light, bubbly layer of quickly diminishing, brownish tan head foam, and light spots of lacing. The nose was roasted & cocoa, with subtle woody & nutty hints. Light to medium bodied, with low carbonation, and a light silkiness to the mouthfeel, the taste added modest earthy & roasted bitterness, and a touch of sweetness. Tasty, but only a light dessert.

Pitch black, reddish bricky low head. Aroma of fresh espresso and prunes in chocolate. Unfolds with higher temperature, dont drink this too cold! Palate heavy, carbonation low. Taste complex : black soya sauce saltiness, south american cocoa jungle earthiness gives way to nice collection of dried forest fruit. Lots of cocoa nibs in finish. And something you can never tell what it is. Luxury brew.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 (01/12/2016) On tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Dark with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Bitter sweet taste, full chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, full chocolate aftertaste. Very nice. 7/4/8/4/16
(2/19/2016) Bottle at home. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cacao,  earth, coffee. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate bitter, cacao, lactose, coffee, bitter roasted aftertaste. Nice. 7/4/8/4/16

(bottle - 330 ml) Dark brown pour with a thick tan head. Light roasted malt and coffee aroma. Not much hint of the wood. Roasted coffee at the start with a quick shift to bitterness. Definite hints of cocoa nibs near the finish. Watery and thin finish.

Opaque black, medium brown head. Aroma: lots of cocoa, malty, some kind of sourness, lactose, coconut, wood; very complex. Body is medium, heavy sweetness, medium bitterness. In taste again lots of cocoa, lactose, it really reminds chocolate. Bit roasty finish.

Pitch black colour with coffee foam, average and creamy, fairly lasting brown head. Lot of dark malty aroma, like a brownie cake, "bounty" , little woody touch, background is the liquorice. Taste is amazing , roasty dark malty with cocoa, coconut notes, little sweet hints of smooth milk chocolate, soft and silky finish.

7.4%ABV. Stout.

Poured out black. 40ºSRM.

Nose has some nice smoky aromas with tobacco leaf richness, the clean aroma note of mesquite charcoal. Chocolate and coffee aromas are almost obligatory. Maybe a hint of the organic vegetal nature of peat. Prunes and stewed fruit, apples and pears at the end of the nose. Funky sourness suggestive of boiled raw cane sugar.


Mouthfeel is somewhere between soapy and thinly syrupy. Palate has flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, yakitori, figs, honeyed dates, butterscotch and sticky date pudding breadth, Local tasting notes, char Siew burnt ends, bakkwa (which is a local grilled jerky)

Finish is medium and actually surprisingly not annoying.

Goes on Favorites List!

Bottle, thanks Matt, post SX Bottle Share, 5/01/2015. 

Opaque with black lacing. Swiss milk chocolate, grains, leather, blackcurrants, cocoa and prunes. Really nice.

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Black pour with a tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasted sweet spice, blackberries, licorice and toffee. Flavours of dark chocolate, warm spice, licorice, cocoa and coffee. Smooth, sweet smoky mouthfeel. Dry, sweet finish. Tasty.

Smooth with rich chocolate and lactose sugar. Only a barely-there hop bitter bite on the finish. Neatly uncarbonated, which adds to the silkiness. A very good stout.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Last beer of 2015. New Years beer no. 6. Bottle from stirchley wines. Black beer with medium tan head. Aroma of cocoa powder, lactose and hints of barrel aging. Taste is roast malts, lactose, chocolate and some sweetness. Creamy palate. Very good. Happy New Year - 2016.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Black body with low tan head. Aroma has slight coffee tone with a lot of chocolate, toffee. Body is full, high carbonation. Taste has sweet cake like profile, low fruity carbonation.

Bottle from Bottle Baron. Pours opaque black, dark brown head. Nose is rich, cocoa, fruits, gentle roast, creamy milky aromas. Taste follows: nice fruits, cocoa, gentle roast, rather sweet, milk shake-like frothiness, chocolate, light smoke. This is one of those beers you need to offer your better half when getting some nagging about your hobby. Excellent dessert beer.

Pitch black, visibly thick with a tall espresso head with good retention. Smells like roasted grains, dark chocolate, cocoa, dark cherries and a bit of vanilla. Tastes like dark chocolate, roasted grains, slightly smoky, cocoa, dark cherries, espresso. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation and a bitter-sweet (mostly sweet) aftertaste.
Draft at beertemple. Aroma of creamy milky chocolate. Nice sticky taste of creamy milk chocolate, red fruit, raisin and caramel. Nice.
Black with tan ring. Fruity woody choclate cake aroma. FRuity raisiny chocolate milk sweetness with licoriice and woody sweet fruity finish. medium body oily. Pretty good.

Black pour with a tan/brown head and light spotted lacing .... Aroma of chocolate cake indeed as well as light roasted malts, orange, cocoa nibs and light sweet lactose .... Taste is of lactose sugar, cocoa nibs, orange, roasted malts and chocolate .... Dry finish with some lingering roasted and cocoa flavors .... Body is rich and full with a slick and oily mouthfeel

Pours an opaque dark brown almost black like oil color with similar viscosity and khaki colored head. It does smell like chocolate cake, with just a little wood and sweetness on the nose; follows onto the palate. Full bodied, yet smooth. Finishes like a piece of chocolate cake. Nicely done.

Black or opaque brown beer with a thin brown head. Rich smell of dark chocolate and coffee.Flavour has those two as well, with some liquorice-y, earthy malt. Theres also some slightly hoppy backtaste there where the fruit kicks in. Theres quite a bit going on here. Its rich and hearty and absolutely delicious and the slight fiss and tanginess of the fruit gives it a lovely little kick.

Dark as hell color, dark fruit, malt, licorice smell, they say a lot of CO2, mine was barely any CO2, very very thin head. The taste is is sweet, coca, raisiny taste, the swallow has a very, very high note of sweetness that lingers for a bit. A little spicy burn at the end as well, cant figure out why but I love it. One of my favorite beers I have had all year. 

They have his as a Foreign Stout, dont be fooled this is as much as a Sweet Stout as Creme Bruele!

Cocoa bomb... pours a deep velvet like bunrt umber color with a trace of khaki foam. Dark creamy chocolate, seductive and nuanced but silky smooth and balanced even if it is a chocolate bomb. Nice complementing earth and spicy dark fruit undertones but honestly just a tasty treat to coat the mouth with and let the chocolate take you for a gentle ride down milk stout lane.

Bottle @Mother-in-laws. Pours black with a big tan head which dissipates over a couple of minutes. Nose is chocolate, sweetness, malty tones, its got a good nose but not a great nose. Taste is more of the same but with added licorice, very slight vanilla, you do get the wood coming through, its almost as if its adding alcohol flavor to the beer. Fantastic.

Keg @ In De Wildeman. Black color. Light brown head with reasonable retention. Aromas: hard roast, coffee, light acidic, bitter chocolate. Retronasal the chocolate is upfront, light sweet, roasted. Moderate to full sweet flavor, chocolate. Medium bodied. Lots of chocolate in the finish, a bit dry, but hardly bitter. Sweet, but nice.

Keg @ The Cellar, Chester [011215]
Pitch black, thin tan head
Aroma of dark malts, lots of dark chocolate, soft roast
Taste of rich dark malts, dark chocolate, almost no roast, theres a citrus note in there, complex dark malts, yummy, very moreish, its a stunner
Palate - Medium to full body, rich, sweet but not too much. Finish of rich dark chocolate, complex.
Overall - Just superb. Best beer on the trip by a long way
33cl bottle thanks calvin . Black pour. Cypress wood dominates. Some dark fruit flavors. Not pungeqnt but not smooth kind of just in existence.

Bottle at home. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, roastyness, coffee, sweetness. Taste is big chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, slight plum in there as well. Nice and soft on the carbonation. Really enjoyed this.

On tap at In de Wildeman. Black colour, creamy beige-brown head. Aroma is sweet, milk chocolate, cocoa, hint of vanilla, lactose, some roasted malts, hint of coffee. Flavour is quite sweet, milky, chocolate, roasted malts, hint of vanilla, cocoa, light fruity, coffee, bittersweet finish. Medium bodied at best. Nice, but very sweet.

On tap at In de Wildeman. Opaque black with a huge, creamy, brown head. Sweetish, roasty-malty aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and burnt nuts. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty taste of milk chocolate, nougat, coffee and burnt nuts, followed by a short, slightly bitter and roasty finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good!

Appearance: deep dark with thick beige head. 
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, vague coffee.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 17-11-16. wysoka, dosc drobnopecherzykowa, ciemno brazowa piana. fajnie brudzi szklo. piwo czarne. aromat kawowy, kakaowy, rumowy, czekoladowo-pralinkowy czy moze raczej ciasta czekoladowego, waniliowy, palony. "tropical stout" to nie marketing. ta tropikalnosc, zwlaszcza kokos daja duzy efekt "wow" przy pierwszym lyku, wiekszy, niz niejedno piwo wyzej ocenione przeze mnie :) tak czy inaczej - super.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

33cl bottle, new batch at home. poured a black creamy colour with a bigger mocha coloured head on top. nose has lactose, creamy sweet bakers chocolate, milke chocolate, whipped cream, toasted nuts, licorice, and roasted notes. taste is fairly sweet, fruit chocolate cake, wood, chocolate cherries, dry mouthfeel. pretty tasty brew.

20/XI/15 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 20/X/16 (2015-1635) Thanks to Beerlover_Ben for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy dark brown to black beer, small creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of caramel, milk chocolate, mocha, coffee, roasted. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: lots of chocolate, no lies there! Bit sourish, caramel, some lactose. Aftertaste: dried fruits, roasted, bit sourish, coffee, caramel, mocha. Lovely beer and a great dessert!

Bottled, 330ml from Oeno, Cirencester, Gloucs. Black with tan head. There is a rich, milky chocolate character to this from the off, loads of depth and just a little chocolate bitterness. A fruity, herby note then comes through, I had a hint of cherry along with basil and a light chilli note. Loads going on, always interesting, very good beer.

Bottle share by Jim, pours black with small off white head. Aromas and flavor are strong roast, licorice, wood, orange, and cocoa. A touch of smoke and meat but mostly a nice foreign roast similiar to a de Molen light.
Draft. Weird just weird. Delicious and awful at the same time. A little thin bodied. Taste like fruit cake in a glass

Pours black with a thin cocoa head. Aroma is a smokey, dark chocolate powder and tobacco mix. A very smooth palate. Its a rich, dark chocolate taste with a slight bitterness to the finish. Almost like a real dark chocolate milkshake.
Bottle from hop hideout. Black with dark tan head. Aroma is rich chocolate and spice, a little farmy too. Taste is sweet and bitter, a little dry and spiced too. Tingly with a oily mouthfeel. Nice.
Tap at the Cock Tavern. Pours pitch black with a thin beige head. Rich and creamy texture. Caramel, coffee, dark fruits, a dash of Worcestershire sauce. Highly enjoyable.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Silky smooth - like satin lingerie. Deliciously rich. Sweet choc and Ash. Some scent of swimming pool (perhaps in a refurbished 1930s stately home). Really a good beer.

33cl in brewdock Dublin. Pours jet black with thin off white head. Aroma is coffee, molasses, lactose, dark chocolate earth. Flavour is deep chocolate with coffee, lactose, wood lifts. This a deep beer. Lovely.

Bottle. Pitch black with a fading coffee brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, lactose, vanilla, dark fruits. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, liquorice, roasted, nutty, hint of pine. Slick oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
chocolate, coffee, roasty, woody, herbs, earthy, black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

Aroma: dark chocolate, cacao, light lactose, toasted malts, a weird touch of floral hops. Appearance: black, massive, beige, frothy head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: heavy chocolaty sweets continue, praline, dark fruits, cacao, hot chocolate, light bitters in the finish, full bodied. Overall: excellent Foreign Stout, massive chocolate throughout. Pint at the White Horse, Parsons Green.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 Bottle at tderoecks place. Wow, dark chocolate, milky stout, truly a desert on its own.
Cask at The Euston tap. Poured jet black with light brown head. Nose is rich chocolate, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is smooth chocolate, vanilla. Cocoa, cherry fruit. Rich smooth dark. Most impressive.

Bottle. Pours black with a slight coffee coloured head. Strong choclate aromas with some coffee, smoke and vanilla. Taste is very luxurious and rich. Sweet and bitter. Gorgeous but one bottle at a time is plenty.

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Fierce-looking black with brown head, some lacing. Dark malty, molasses-filled aroma. Taste is roasty bitter coffee, sweet dark chocolate. Wood notes running through. Decent stuff, but somehow I expected a bit more from it.
Black with tan head. Creamy mouthfeel, with lots of chocolate, vanilla, hints of wood. Soft carbonation, medium bodied. Tasty stuff, but pretty rich.

Bottle. Black body with a thick tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of rich chocolate, sugar and wood. Flavour of chocolate ice-cream, pine, vanilla and a hint of orange zest. Medium body with a slick texture. Soft fizz. Lives up to its name - this is a cake-like Stout. I wouldnt want more than one.

330 ml bottle BB Dec 31st 2014, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Black body, with a medium, dense, coffee colored head.
Aroma is quite sweet, with dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, cocoa, wood.
Tastes of smooth coffee, cocoa, vanilla, wood, some dark fruits.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, quite dry, with coffee, wood, cocoa, milk chocolate.

Tasty. Drinks very smooth, alcohol is completely hidden. The nose is a bit too sweet for me, but the taste is greatly balanced, cocoa is very well integrated. Great, comfortable Stout.

330ml bottle at home shared with Saeglopur, from trade with Nische, many thanks. BB 12/2014. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells of malty roast, ash, bitter chocolate, peat, spices. overall nice smell, peat notes a bit too present though. full body, soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. tastes of ash, coffee, bitter chocolate, light berry notes, milky / creamy, hints of sweetness, spices, some wood, lightly sour. finishes with very nice notes of creamy bitter chocolate and of light ash and nice roast notes. not so crazy about the smell, but the taste and especially the finish is very nice, just a tad bit medical though.

Draught. Black beer with an brownish head. Roasted licorice Woody dark fruits tar chocolate aroma. Roasted chocolate licorice vanilla caramell woody fruity and cocoa powder flavour. Really nice Lovely beer :-)

330 ml bottle. Rating this one mainly for the tick. Unfortunately my bottle leaked and it was rather oxidized when I drank it. It had a glorious aroma, but it wont be fair to judge it in these conditions. 3.8 as its the current average score and I dont want to change anything.

Bottle thanks to secret santa. Pours opaque black, small brown head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is smoky, woody, cocoa. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, lactose, wood smoke. Fullish body. Quite interesting.
woody, vanilla, alcoholl, caramel, coffee, tropical, black, minimal head, hazy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Bottle from Systembolaget. Smell of chocolate, coffee, fruits, dark malts and coconut. Similar taste with chocolate and coconut. Creamy mouthfeel. Nice.

Bouteille 33cl de Malt Attacks, BB 31/12/2014.
Brune foncée, presque noire, col épais crémeux moka laissant un léger doré au verre.
Arôme met de suite laccent sur les notes douces du lactose. Ces dernières sont ponctuées par le bouquet distinct, mais timide, du cèdre qui apporte des effluves épicées et boisées. Ayant Cigar City comme exemple, le cèdre reste plus mitigé dans son usage. La malt chocolaté et le cacao arrivent à percer en rétro.
Palais est profond au niveau malté avec un fini sec au palais attirant lattention sur leffet boisé du cèdre. Ce dernier reste présent tout en étant un peu plus discret dans sa complexité. On retrouve un fini épicé lié au boisé typique du cèdre. Le chocolat est également présent avec une petite note amer sur la fin. Le lactose reste également bien présent ajoutant un fini adouci et typique, ce dernier se mariant bien au côté plus sec du cèdre.
KRS 270914. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is cocoa, malt, hop. flavour is cocoa, roasted malt, milky sour, chocolate, coffee. Full body. Very nice beer.

Bottle from BeerRitz, Leeds. An inky black beer that pours with a thin tan head. It has a very rich chocolate and cherry flavour, vanilla notes and a sweet and tart fruity, slight roasted chocolate finish.
330ml bottle at home, present from Stuartyboy - opaque very dark brown near black, no head, roasted malty, cocoa aroma, sweet, cocoa, viscous, chocolate, some berries

Clear red brown colour, no head. Aroma of caramel, malts, raisins. Light sweet flavour, malts, wood, slightest hint of cacao. Finish wood, malts, caramel and burned sugar.(from draught @ CBC green session, Copenhagen 2014. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a brown head.
Aroma: Chocolate, liquorice, caramel, sweet malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, vanilla, tropical fruit, liquorice.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av choklad, rostad malt, karamell, kakao, trä med toner av torkad frukt. Rund och len, lagom sötma, lätt syrlighet, beska med smak av bitter mörk choklad. Mycket elegant.

Poured from a bottle (Best Before 31 December 2014) into a teku glass. Pours coffee black with a thin but somewhat generous coffee brown head. 

A lot of the cacao and cypress wood on the nose. Not so much the lactose. Also a good amount of roast malts.  Upon warming up a lot of the tropical fruits such as  passion fruit.

The palate is medium bodied but quite foamy. The attack is very cacao/dark chocolate forward. A slight tartness and sweetness from the milk sugar also becomes very apparent. Just a slight coffee bitterness in the middle but overall, a very easy drinking stout. The darkness of the chocolate is balanced by the brighter flavors of the milk sugar. Tropical fruit flavors also appear a lot more upon warming up. In general, the flavors are not very intense as expected from this style. If youre looking for something a little more, Id recommend the Shattered Dream.
toast, roasty, resin, black, sparkling, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, lively, long finish,

Draught at CBC 2014. Opaque black liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, wood, spices, pears and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of chocolate and dried fruit. Full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

[6987-20141219] 330mL bottle. Roasted sweet grains aroma. Black body with a medium-lasting foamy tan head. Roasty grains and sweet old malt flavour. Full body. Tasty. (7/3/8/4/16) 3.8
(w/ Ferris, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Have you ever been so happy for cancer??"

2014-12-19. Black body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma is interesting, lightly alcoholic, dryish cocoa, lightly tangy. Flavour has sweet dark malt core, lightly bitter, notes of cocoa. 7++ Medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+ Pretty nice stuff. Bottle from Alesela, Glasgow.
Bottle - Syrupy, chocolate and coca. Deep jet brown with a brown head. Chocolate, light sweetness and a syrupy finish. A bit syrupy and sweet.
Bottle in Vesuvio, Darlington. Pours black with a tan head. The taste is rich and delicious. Loads of chocolate and a touch of heat. Extremely good.

330ml bottle. Pitch black colour with late awakening, average, dense, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, brown head. Dark malty aroma has dry, herbal cocoa notes, hints of lactic acid, a woody touch, background-ish liquorice. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty with cocoa notes, minimally sweet hints of milk chocolate, a touch of lactic acid, unspecific fruitiness; lasting finish, smooth, soft, silky palate.

Bottle at home picked up at mother Kellys about 8 months ago. Opaque black pour with a lively creamy dark tan head. Aroma is sweet smooth roasted malts, berry red currant fruits. Some cakey and chocolate malts with just a hint of smoke on the nose as well. Flavour Is composed of smooth sweet caramel, cakey malts with some biting roast ashy bite in the finish. Secondary red currant dried cranberry flavours some lactose sweetness and a little spice. Palate is full with airy high carbonation and a semi dry finish. Little lactose sweetness rounds it out nicely.

33cl, new exclusive English collab. brew Anno 2014, with cacao, Cypress wood and lactose, from Voldby Købmandsgaard Hammel, complex sweet Stout, roasted/sweet and slightly woody/spicy, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Bottle from systembolaget, sweden. Thick almost permanent brown head. Rich chocolate aroma with vanilla and just a tuch of coffey. Balanced dark malt taste with the bitterness. Full body.
Flaska från SB. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Söt doft av choklad. Vattnig med inslag av tjära.

Aroma is roasted, malty and spicy. The taste takes you on a ride with milk chocolate, vanilla, malts and burned coconuts. A little salty. Light and dry in the finish. This stout takes you on a boat trip through the archipelago of the Caribia, making stops on all the small islands where you try out the local flavors from cocoa, salt water and inhaling burned Cypress wood and vanilla. Very pleasant.

Bottle: Thanks Hackobock: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized brown head. Black beer.
Aromas of chocolate, coffee, some raisin, some mocha, some roast, some hints of roaste sweetness and some cabbage/manure tints.
Flavours of sweet, bitter, roast, dark chocolate, cacoa, coffee, caramel, some mocha, some sweet wood roast...
Aftertaste is bitter, chocolate, light coffee, mocha and light roast.
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Very nice stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
08.11.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and roasted, dark malts, dark sugar, salty licorice, dark fruits, wood, lactose, sour coffee, grass. Taste is slightly sour-ish roasted, dark malts, sour coffee, burnt caramel, minerals, grass, wood, dark fruits, dark sugar, sweet licorice, hay, cocoa. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle bought at Systembolaget. Black drink with high brown foam with large bubbles that quickly disappear, leaving marks on the glass. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and wet leather. Soft and gentle mouth feel with flavors of dark chocolate, vanilla and coffee beans.
Una cerveza muy espectacular, aroma a chocolate suave, no muy dulce. no empalaga i tiene una densidad y color negro bastante suggerentes.

Backlog rating. 33cl bottle from Ales by Mail. It pours a dark brown color with a medium tan head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of dark chocolate, toffee, vanilla and light booze. Taste is big, bold and sweet with more dark chocolate, raisins, bread, vanilla and honey. Light roastiness to keep the finish a bit drier. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, really good but I feel it fails to deliver all the goodness that the name and description would suggest

Last beer of the night. Thanks!

A: Black body, mocha head, legs. 

N: Molasses, cocoa, wood, lactose, char, and smoke. 

T: Bittersweetness. Nicely balance - wonder if its the cypresswood showing up here. 

M: Thick body, light carbonation.

O: This is an island in the sun! (I have kids, sue me.) Being the last beer of the night, I can only hope I gave this the attention it deserved. I did rather enjoy it.

Bottle shared by Doug, last beer of the Portland tasting. Thanks for hosting 
Black with a small tan head, good lacing. Aroma of dark malts and chocolate. Taste of chocolate, sweet/dark malts, woody and ash 
Nice stout
Bottle. Pours a dark chocolate color with a medium brown head. The aroma is big cocoa, milk and toast. The flavor is chocolate,ash, lactose, some big smoke, very good.
33cl bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours black with little head. Sweet and fruity aroma with coffee, cocoa and fruits.
Bottle from Deliciously Different. Dark brown colour, thin head. Medium carbonation. Sweet roastiness, tropical fruit, wood and coffee. Medium body. Tastefull stout!
Black and with a dark head. Roasted aroma, with notes of woody resins. Flavor starts sweet too, heavy roasted and more wood.

330 ml bottle shared @ The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Pitch-black color, brown thick head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak, dark fruits. Sweet taste, pretty much the same, sweet chocolate, liqourice, plums, raisins, oak, vanilla, some alcohol notes. Excellent aftertaste, long. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

Bottle picked up at Beers of Europe, consumed at Isobels, Saturday 11th October 2014   Pours black with a large light beige head. Nose has a fresher feel than I expected, but there is a little creamy chocolate, I think the creaminess is more lactose but you get some creamy mousse, mmhh... its lovely. I am quite surprised that I am getting the coconut and to a lesser extent pineapple. Truly a lovely indulgent beer.  A7 A5 T9 P4 Ov16 4.1

Riktigt god. Doftar lite mjuk pepparkaka. Riktigt god. Elegant, mycket smak och len. En av få stouter jag vill ha fler utan att den är tunn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow. Lots going on here. The most impressive aspects are the array of flavours presented in a moderate abv and the fact that this does feel like a summer/beach stout - very bright and fun.

Pours deep brown, thin beige head. Aroma is sweet has some coffee, cherries, bit of lactose and liquorice. Body is heavy and light at the same time. Sweet tropical fruits, cocoa, bitter chocolate. Complex but still light and easy drinking, quite amazing what they have done here for this relatively low ABV. This beer can be enjoyed as a dessert all by itself.

Bottle. Aroma is light roast, milky, bit of smoke maybe even a bit fruity. Smooth, creamy, roast again, little bit of spice, punchy and fruity. Lots of taste for the %. Dark fruit and something tropical too. Milky finish. Cracker!

Beautiful pitch black color with dark brown head. Very lovely looking. Big chocolat cake, fudge, dark fruit and cacao nose. Smooth rich mouth with lots of chocolate cake, cacao. Intense. Mildly sweet. Very smooth and rounded. Really fruity. Amazing stuff.
Kolsvart med mörkbrunt stort skum.Doftar och smakar choklad, kaffe och lite vanilj. Tyvärr så är den blaskig!
Bottle. Color black with almost no head. Aroma chocolate, caramel. Taste chocolate bitter, caramel, wood, fruits.
Svart med ett mörk brunt skum. Doft: Kaffe, cola isglass, kola, körsbär, kakao, ädelträ. Smak: Choklad pralin, kaffe, kakor, körsbär och russin doppade i choklad, cola, kola. Riktigt smarrig.

Bottle. It pours an almost black body and a small, dense, tan head leaving lacings. The aroma is nice but a bit weak. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, aromatic wood and a citrusy touch. Some alcohol notes. Its super-smooth on the palalte, with a soft carbonation level. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, wood, coffee and sweetness. Full body. Faintly chili-spiced in the finish. Pretty lovely this one. 140927

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, oak and some fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long chocolate, caramel and cocoa finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours black with a dense brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, ash, some bacon notes, chocolate and caramel. Flavor is sweet and roasted malt with some grains, coffee, roasted malt, wood and ash. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Thick and creamy with almost no head. Loads of chocolate and roasted notes both in aroma and taste. Wonderfully creamy mouthfeel. This is good!
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Black with beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, some tar, some ash tray. Medium to full bodied, low to medium carbonation. Sweet with medium bitterness.
