330ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines, drunk while watching Boyhood at the cinema. A great film. This pours dark with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and very light cocoa. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, fruitcake and very light chocolate elements coming through. Expected more.

August 17, 2014. Bottle, best before december 31, 2014. 
Pours black with a very small brown head. Aroma is milk chocolate, dark bitter chocolate, light coffee and wood. Taste is medium sweet milk chocolate, light bitter roasted, smooth rounded milk chocolate finish with a light dry wood note. Medium bodied, smooth oily texture, soft carbonation.
Pitch black, mahogany brown head... Aroma of smoke, dark chocolate, wood... Flavor is cedarwood, smoke, spices, chocolate, dark roasted malts... Spices on finish... Solid, hoping for more

Pours black with a tan head. 
Smells of cocoa, coffee and bonfire.
Medium body with a slightly oily texture and a long finish. 
Very balanced taste of above mentioned smells with a hint of licorice that fades into tar, resin and dark chocolate/cocoa.

The aroma of chocolate and hints of coffee beans. The taste is of cold coffee, dark chocolate and soy but still feels very dry also. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Truly a piece of heavy drinking. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
330 ml ur beställningssortimentet på systembolaget, krämig och fyllig med tydliga toner av kaffe och choklad, vansinnigt god
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a little sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, and coconut - with a slightly dry finish.
Overall: Dark chocolate, bitter cocoa beans, dark dried fruits, sweet brown sugar.Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-08-25.
Poured deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of milk chocolate, latte, dark fruit, fudge, roast malt. Medium body, flavour much as the aroma, quite creamy, bitter sweet finish.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a small, tan head. 
Sweet, dark chocolate in the aroma along with some dried figs. 
Sweet liquorice and chocolate in the flavour with some tar. 
Medium bitterness.

Bottle.
Pours black with a small brown head.
Quite dry and very chocolatey and sweet. Coffee and rosted malts.

330 ml bottle. Near black with mocca head. Aroma of alcohol, chocolate, cookies, bourbon and roasted malt. Taste is thinner than expected, sweet, chocolate, booze and sweet roasted malt notes. Chocolate in the finish
Bottle @ Champ League Kval. Aab - Apoel. Pours black with a creamy head. Smooth and soft. Silky. Charcoal, ash, coffee roast and wood. Milky chocolate. Quite tasty.
Bottle @ AaB vs Apoel CL tasting. Dark brown body with a medium brown head. Chocolate, cocoa, wood, roasted malt. Silk soft, smooth. Delicious.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Smell is deep and roasted, almost porter-like. Light tones of coffee and malts together with a strong scent of chocolates. Pours black with a rich brown head. Taste is nice and rich. A very strong note of chocolate and a more subtle hint of fruits. Palate is nice and the drink places itself nicely in the mouth. Overall a really nice beer, however it lacks some in aroma and the taste could be more complex, although it is good.
Bottled:Black with a large head.Aroma is licorice, cocoa and coffee.Taste is roasted malt, licorice, coffee and cocoa.A liquid chocolate bar.

330ml bottle from Beer Central, Sheffield - Deep reddy brown body, thin tan head that last seconds. Nose is all rich chocolate, a bit of booze, lots of roastiness and burnt toast. Taste is a lot sweeter than the aroma promises, with a more milky chocolate feel on the tongue, almost like a chocolate milkshake. Mouthfeel is lovely and oily. Winner.

Bottle in Mother Kellys during RBESG 2014. Colour is opaque very dark brown to black, tan head. Nose is very rich, chocolate cake, dark chocolate, light rum, bit milky and some lactose. Taste is rich, very sweet, very chocolatey, with choc cake, rich dark chocolate and hints of rum, little bit of milkiness and sugary sweetness. Body is full and rich too.

Bottle enjoyed at the Ale House, Chelmsford. Pours almost black with a good sized tan colour head. Warming dark malt chocolate aroma, slightly toasted with a hint of Caribbean spice cake. Medium sweetness, very smooth, creamy texture, low carbonation. Quite glorious. Could be topped if there was a Caribbean Chocolate Rum Cake version?

Bottle from SB cons 2014-08-10 Göteborg
AR: mm great chocolate muffins, tropical fruits, papaya, café espresso, Bounty bar
AP: darkest ruby, high dark chocolate brown stouthy steady head - looks light chocolate moose, 
F: dark bitter chocolate cake, white sugary, coffey with treated long life milk (is this the lactose?), smooth body, a hint of dried tropical fruits, sweet liqurice, roasted malt, wee citric, a bit thin finishes, overal everything is very good except the flavour

@ Basunen 14-08-09: ganska diskret doft av choklad. Smaken är lite söt, tydlig rökig och med en tydlig ton av choklad och vanilj. Helt ok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!
En bra balanserad Stout med kraftigt inslag av mörk choklad. Viss humle i aromen.

Ja vad ska man säga där. Snygg färg. Fint skum men den var väl lite väl blaskig kanske

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ The Rover. Pours blackish brown with a rather small mocha head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet and malty with roasted malts, dark chocolate, charred wood, sweet liquorice candy, hay, moist soil, sweetened dark roast coffee and hints if burnt caramel. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, brown sugar, resinous wood, dark chocolate, milk duds, hay, sweet liquorice candy and soil. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny roasted astringent and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, milk duds, hay, sweet liquorice candy and hints of burnt wood. Bit too sweet but tasty...
A highly suitable name! Pours a thick dark liquified cake, with hints of vanilla and chocolate in the aroma.Delicious taste, a beer to enjoy slowly.

Dark brown, very small head, no lacing really, couldnt see any carbonation, very much a beer that tastes like affocato ie strong coffee, sweet but milky. Had a 9% stout that tasted like this at evening star in Brighton but this particular beer was from bottle shop Canterbury.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Siren / Cigar City Caribbean Chocolate Cake ].Clear dark black brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, cacao, smoke. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, chocolate, smoked, wood. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140416]
Bottle. Pours thick black with a fairly big tan head. Nose has orangepeel, chocolate and pineapple. Taste has milkchocolate, pineapple and some coconut.

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, wood, vanilla, cocoa, roasted malts, soft liquorice and a slight note of brownie. Taste has those same notes and is overall sweet and roasted. Medium body and a bit savory in the end. Nice and easy stout!

Bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Aromas are chocolate milkshake with creamy oak barrel and nutty notes. Ginger beer with mellow oranges and marzipan alcohol. Flavours are sweet chocolate and spiced oranges with lactose. Meal replacement milkshake with roast coffee berry aspects. Very smooth and drinkable with some residual brown sugar at the end. Quite mellow. Good stuff.
Sweet lactose and chocolate aroma, the lactose overpowers the stout and chocolate flavours. I was expecting more of a spicy hit. Good, but not world class .

(330ml bottle bb dec 2014) espresso brown, soapy head, quite bubbly. Nose of lactose, cacao nibs, bakers chocolate, orange, cream, cypress wood. Taste of lactose, a little woody and herbal, lightly bitter chocolate, near orange zest bitterness, medium to light in body.

Pours a dark dark brown. Lovely milky brown head. Good legs. Cinder toffee and roast choc nose. Silky orgasmic mouthfeel. Spicy and sweet taste. Good stout, a pudding in itself. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours black with a big creamy/frothy tanned head. Inviting dark malty chocolate aroma, roast and liquorice. Smooth & creamy mouthfeel. Taste is rich dark malty,roasted chocolate,sweet liquorice, lingering liquorice as well, a tasty and moreish beer, lovely.

Dark with nice crema. Aroma roasted malt, smoked, tar, mokka sweet dark fruit. Taste bittersweet with smoked and roasted tones, mokka, sweet dark. Full body, smooth, thick, creamy. Finish bittersweet .

Bottle. Pitch black with a large creamy dark brown head. Dusty, cocoa, vanilla, wood, brown sugar. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Yeah, its a bit sweet and goopy and I dont get the overall idea. It is written on the bottle but tldr. So all in all it is sweet with lots of chocolate.

On keg at The Bottle shop, Druid Street, Bermondsey, London. A black coloured pour with a healthy tan/beige head on top. Rich, roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, rich, roasty, malty, chocolate, slightly sweet and bitter. Nice stout.

Draught at Taphouse, København. Pitch black - light brown head. Licorice. Dark chocolate. High malty. Sweetness. Cake notes. Ok bitterness. Fruity notes. Ok light bitterness. Acid notes. Smooth body. Cocoa. Dusty cocoa.

Bottle from Brewdog bottle shop into tulip glass. Nice dark black with tan head, tight foam. Oily cocoa, vanilla, strong milky, liquorice, some coffee. Wow, medium to thick body in the mouth, loads of sweetness up front with lasting bitterness, the end body as you swallow is almost like swallowing marshmallow, or air in a good way? Doesnt leave any cloying feeling, just a really pleasant lingering chocolate and cyprus almost orange taste. Very, very nice.
Hints of licorice and cacao. Thick body , nice mocha head. Creamy mouthfeel, feels almost like a thick chocolate milkshake. It tastes exactly as the name would suggest!
On tap at the Bottle Shop London. Black beer thick tan head. Cedar barrel ageing is subtle. Gives it dryness. Roast chocolate and wood. Its decent. Good dark chocolate. Lovely.
Draught. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma, Chocolate notes. Heavy bitter nice roasted flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Draft. Black pour with tan head. Roasted and chocolate sweet aromas. Flavors of roasted and chocolate dark tones, sweet throughout.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2014 Pours a deep brown black, with a thick, creamy heavily tinted head. Aroma is heavily malted, with a chocolate edge and notes of orange. Taste is that of a quality breakfast stout, with a pleasant upfront bitterness lent by the the cacao and cypress wood aging, which is in itself softened by softened by notes of tropical fruit. 

All in all a really enjoyable chocolate influenced milk stout with some nice subtleties provided by the the hop selection and the cypress wood.

EDIT: Had another bottle, 26/06/2014. Just as good as the first, but even more enjoyable with a little more concentration on exactly whats going on in this incredible concoction. Bumped up the score to 4.2. Sublime.

Draught @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours cloudy very dark brown with stable rich tan head. Dark aroma of coffee, caramel malt, barrel, and roast. Sweet flavour of malt, caramel, chocolate and some fruit, with bitter and roasty notes. Lively carbonation, not disturbing the good, creamy mouthfeel. Roasty and rough aftertaste. A very good Foreign Stout!

fra fad.
duft: kaffe. kakao. riste malt bød duft
smag; kakao. kaffe. sød. mørkebær. kakao skum. virkelig en blød og behagelig stout

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours black with a huge, dense, nut brown head. Aroma is full of chocolate, wood, dry roast. Fairly bitter. Taste has the same brownie-like chocolate which is very dry and dark. Lots of wood here as well. A nice sweetness in the back. The body is rather nice, but it sure could use some more alcohol in my opinion. Medium carb. Nice and good looking, but seems a little expensive.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours black with a medium brown mocca head. Aromas of slight smoke, slight rum, coconut, dark chocolate, burned coffee. Taste is slighty smokey and roasted with some coconut and has alot of fruity sweetness to it. Ends in a dry, smoked and woody taste with some of that before said sweetness to it. Some bitter cacao aswell.

Intenso color negro espuma beige. Aromas de cacao y frutos rojos, algo herbal. Cuerpo medio con inicio dulce que recueda al azúcar mmmmm moreno con algo de chocolate y el Amargor final es tostado y de lupulo afrutado. Muy rica.

Aroma: smokey roasted sweet.
Flavor: roasted coffee and nice bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel.
Color: very dark brown with a brown head.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2014 Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Black with a big and lasting brown head. Aroma is dry, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and wood. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. 140614 --- CBC. Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. 030514 8/4/8/4/15

Tap. Nearly black body with a small, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, wood and brown sugar. Sweet flavor with a bitter finish and alcohol too. Full to medium bodied, oily texture and average carb. An excellent stout.

Keg at Flying Elk, Stockholm.  Jet black with beige head. Chocolate, vanilla and cedar up front. Mid sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Doninated by milk chocolate. Quite mild and rich with light notes of salty licorice. Never overpowering. Rich and pleasant.

On tap @ Taphouse Copenhagen. Pours black with a leather colored head. Aroma is roasted malt, bacon, slightly smoked, coffee and rum. Taste has chocolate cake at the end, kahlua, coffee. Full body, medium carb and medium bitterness. Great beer.

- with thirst, Niklas

Tap at CBC Brixton 09/06/14 (...and a Bottle at home.). Tap - Pours deep dark brown with a tan head. Aroma was slight herby, grassy, leafy with a slight medicinal edge. Medium body, medium carbonation. Light stickiness. A light herby, green grassy thing to start then a dark choc coffee with more dark choc and espresso bitterness to finish. I found the bottled version to be that bit richer, smoother and fuller bodied. Both were tasty, though.

1st June 2014Opaque black - brown beer, small tan head. Palate is slightly soft and a little dry. Fine carbonation. Tangy dark malts including the chocolate cake. Trace of spice and a little coconut. Light dry finish. Nice beer but the flavours seem less vibrant then its cask sibling.
Wow. Lashings of chocolate and caramel in the malt. Reminds me of a liquor laden ginger cake. Very creative.
Black with a medium tan head. Aroma of smoke, wood, roasted malt, earthy hops, dark chocolate, coffee. Sweet, really well balanced bitter finish. Oily, low carbonation. Really nice beer.

Bottle from Cornelius. Thick black pour with brown head. Surprisingly light nose, chocolate and milk. Sweet milky taste with hints if coconut and smokey chocolate. Soft finish. Very cakey and agree with others 'chewy' discription. Tasty but a bit milky for me.

330ml. Filthy tar with a luxurious yellow tan mousse. Deep chocolate, fudge and coffee bean aroma completed with suggestions of dried black grape, roasted almonds, Crunchie on fire and general opulent black chocolate cake filth. Utterly lovely bittersweet compacted chocolate-striated flavour with a trace of orange and strawberry Neopolitan-tinged hop from behind a glutinous soupy tar of well-fired brittle black things. They include coffee beans, vanilla pods, carob, prune, 90% raisiny Lindt. Rich ashy finish. Right in the Lion cage. Close to total stout.

Draught at Taphouse. Black with a dark brown head, nice lacings. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, dark chocolate). Flavor medium+ sweet, light bitter. Medium+ body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

tasted both keg and bottle, both pretty similar, rich almost black, fabulous coffee and vanilla aroma, followed by an almost chewy sensation, packed with flavour, its rich and powerful yet subtle at the same time, top notch stout
Nose is almond, decent mediumheavily roasted coffee, cooked vegetables, tar whiff, late cream, feel is mediumbroad, taste is cola, roasted hazel, coffee, fig, late wood chip

Draft. A black beer with a lazing dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, roasted malt, brown sugar, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, roasted malt, alcohol, and brown sugar, leading to a dry finish. Nice.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours thick black, aroma of sweet chocolate, taste is rich chocolate, dry, bitter, roasted malts, tastes like cake!

Bottle at home in London - thanks to Colin for hooking it up. Pours rich, black-brown with a dense, foamy beige head. Great aroma, full of milk chocolate, dark fruits, ashy roast. Medium sweet flavor with somewhat sugary chocolate character, black raspberry, moderate earthy bitterness, dark cocoa, faint burnt wood tang, a bit of toffee, plums and figs. Medium bodied with fine carbonation and silky texture. Sweet finish with more milk chocolate, understated roast, well ripened dark fruits, raisins, touches of smoked meat. A bit of bitter torched earth in the aftertaste. A little on the sweet side but very solid overall.

Black with a quite small caramel head, short retention. Aromas milk and chocolate with caramel malts. Flavour fairly bitter, light sweetness balance. Lactose finish. Slightly oily palate. Full bodied, medium carbonation.

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Pitch black beer with a nice lasting brownish head. Roasted chocolate aroma, cocoa, licorice, woody notes, prunes, raisins, tar notes, caramel, some citrus and mango. Roasted chocolate and cocoa powder flavor, licorice, vanilla, wood, soot, caramel, passion fruit, some prunes. Roasted chocolate and vanilla finish with soot and citrus. Very good.
On tap @ Fermentoren. Very dark brown with a small brown head. Malty and choclate tones. Malt, chocolate and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long sweet and bitter after taste.

Wow. Very chocolate but with such rush roasted barley in, it tastes a little like drinking a BBQ!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Fermentoren. Dominated by chocolate, dried fruits and some caramel.

Bottle at home. Pours opaque black with a quite small, tight bubbled tan head, short retention though a few bubbles linger on top and at the sides, with no lacing. Aroma is sweet milk chocolate, faint tart dark fruits, roast and coffee malt, and faint orange hops. Flavor is dark malt dominant, fairly bitter, dark fruits, light spiciness, light hops and medium bitterness, lactose and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Bottle from Blackfriars Glasgow a deep Brown almost Black ale aroma is coca flavour is rich sweet coca dark chocolate underlying roasted malts and red fruits

330 ml. bottle. It pours a jet black color with a brown head. The aroma is full with chocolate and lactose sweetness. Some molasses and roasted malt. The flavor is rather acidic with intense chocolate, wood and brown sugar. Lactose sweetness carries through to the finish with more dark roast and chocolate. Lots of depth here and very sweet which makes this feel bigger than it is. Very tasty and satisfying.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Köpenhamn. Rostad malt med fruktiga toner, choklad och kaffe, medelsötma och medelbeska, oljig i konsistensen. Avslutningen är torr och besk med rostade toner.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Nice roasty aroma, chocolate, wood, quite meaty. Taste of chocolate, molasses, roastiness, coffee. Medium body, little sweet and sticky
Keg @ Drygate. Very dark brown, not much head. Chocolate coffee aroma. Definite chocolate gateaux flavour. Bitter sweet aftertaste. Well balanced interesting and good.

Fruity aroma heavily laden with dark chocolate. Really dark black. Comes out with a creamy milky thick head. Slightly bitter very rich tasting with a lovely subtle aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Fermentoren, Cph. Pours deep opaque black with a small, staying, lovely, creamy beige head. Aroma has chocolate, cocoa, coconut, coffee, mild citrus and roasted malts. Medium carbonation, fine dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has roasted malts, light astringency, some coconut, dark chocolate. Lingering malty bitterness. Good.
Un gâteau aux fruits hyper onctueux infusé de lait au chocolat. La finale est légèrement tannique et coupe bien les sucres. Solide.

Bottle at home from aleselaviscous thick opaque with fluffy dark tan head. Rich dark berries, high cocoa chocolate, freshly cut wood, rauchsmoke, spicey. Full bodied, cocoa nibs, earthy, savoury umami, touch of vanilla. Not getting the lactose particulary but must be contributing to the richness. Dry woody cocoa finish.

Draught CBC 2014. Pitch black colorued. Roast, cocoa, vanilaa, wood, sourness, chocolate. Flavour. Roast, herbs, cocoa, sweetness, light tropical fruits, chocolate, citrus. Medum to full bodied. Ends roasted bitter.
Pitch black with creamy brown head. Quite sweet aroma and taste of chocolate, vanilla, coconut and a slight hint of lemon with a roasted finish.

From tap. Pours pitch black to brown with a small tan to brown head. Aroma is chocolate and caramelish. Light fruity. Chocolate, bitter and dense dark malty. Dry dark fruity and toasted malty to caramelish. Bitter and dry roasted finish.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours black with a creamy brown head, nice lacings. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, tart fruit, wood. Flavor is malts, coffee, milk chocolate, wood, fruity, light spice. Medium body, lively carbonation. 030514

Draught at the Euston Tap, London on 2 May. Poured black, with a dense tan head. Aroma of cocoa, molasses and fruit cake. Mouth feel was rather rougher than I would expected from the style. Much nicer than I thought it might turn out to be; far less sweet.

text: Lovely dark, roast chocolatey aroma with hint of coffee, deep and dark. I am detecting a woodiness as well. Looking great - jet black with a pretty dark brown head. Wow! Flavour so chocolate, thick, vanilla, coats the tongue with oily silk indulgence. Heavily burnt flavours at the end which in a long drawn out way balance the initial sweetness. The Cypress wood isnt something I know, but it is lending a great aspect to this brew. Great experience, Very impressed!

Grifo. Copa de Cata en el Freiburg (Barcelona). Brota con color negro cubierto por cremosa espuma. La corona es bronceada, persistente y de sólida capa que deja amplios anillos en las paredes. Aromas de chocolate con leche, galleta, frutos del bosque, herbáceos y de moka, redondeados por trazos de moscatel. Entrada muy suave y sabrosa -como era de esperar por los aromas. Cuerpo intenso y carbonatación baja. Paladar untoso y aterciopelado. El ascendente alcohol despliega notas de anís y hierbas,matices de pasa moscatel y madera. La lupulización agradable, la justa para equilibrar el dulzor, queda reforzada por amargor de cacao negro y permanece en el final dulce. Leves notas de mermelada de ciruela en el retrogusto.
On-tap. Tasting glass @ Freiburg (Barcelona). Pours black in color headed by creamy foam. Tan crown is lasting & thick layered. Wide rings are left on sides. Milky chocolate, biscuit, dark fruit, herbal & subtle mocha aromas rounded by hints of muscatel. Very smooth & flavorful upfront as expected from aromas. Full body. Soft carbonation. Velvety & unctuous palate. Increasing alcohol hues display notes of anise & herbs, hints of muscatel raisin & wood. Gentle hoppy -just to balanced- sweetness are reinforced by dark cocoa bitterness & linger into a sweet finish. Slight prune on the aftertaste.

Pours as thick as crude oil and just as dark, with a finger of mocha head. Dark Chocolate forward aroma with wisps of ground coffee, vanilla, cigars and wood. Very light carbonation and maybe a bit overly thick. Initial taste is milk chocolate, coffee cream and vanilla, which all melt into a much more rich deep chocolate cake character. Notes of wood and grassy hops appear in the finish, which is a fairly hefty espresso like bitterness.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a deep mahogany with a huge frothy tan head. The aroma is light roasted malt, chocolate. The flavour is medium bitter, light sweet with a rich, smooth liqourice grassy hop bitter, chocolate palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Not as sweet or as rich as I expected. Lots of hops too. They found some great middle ground.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Jmgreenuk.

22/04/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma beige-cappuccino chiaro, molto persistente. Al naso sentori di cioccolato, vaniglia, leggero caffé, una nota di mela matura. In bocca è dolciastra ma ben equilibrata nelle sue note di cioccolato-caffè, relativamente agevole da bere.
